page.title: 04Colour Works - Matlock Bath
page.content: The{Colour Works}stands on the east bank of the River Derwent.The factory produces powdered pigments used in colouring paint,rubber,plastics and concrete.These are made from natural minerals,originally found locally, such as lead and iron oxide and lime- stone.30% of colours produced are exported.The colours are mainly transported by road in 25 kilo sacks. Although the buildings are old and shed-like the company is now using computers in its administration.It is also now using new high-pressure steam compressed air crushing machinery.The minerals are crushed,ground and blended at the works.Red,yellow and brown pigments are in greatest demand. River Derwent water powers a small turbine but the majority of elec- tricity used comes from the National Grid.
